alert.note: Alert for Brown; Callahan; Runnels; Taylor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 9:31PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A line of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Callahan, northern Brown, Coleman, southeastern Taylor and Runnels Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 929 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms from eastern Callahan County to southwestern Runnels County, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Coleman, Ballinger, Winters, Baird, Santa Anna, Maverick, Cross Plains, Miles, Tuscola, Lawn, Novice, Putnam, Lake Brownwood Near Thrifty, Cross Cut, Bradshaw, Hatchel, Lake Brownwood State Park, Rowena, Atwell and Lake Brownwood. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 307 and 323. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for west central Texas.
